intro: Elatostema longibracteatum var. longibracteatum, commonly known as the narrow-bract elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of plant morphology and ecology.
